sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand BRILINTA, containing Ticagrelor.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand BRILINTA,
Drug Label for drug brand BRILINTA,

sentence.text: <item>BRILINTA, like other antiplatelet agents, can cause significant, sometimes fatal bleeding (5.1, 6.1).
Stopping BRILINTA increases the risk of subsequent cardiovascular events (5.5).
<item>BRILINTA, like other antiplatelet agents, can cause significant, sometimes fatal bleeding (5.1, 6.1).
Stopping BRILINTA increases the risk of subsequent cardiovascular events (5.5).
<item>WARNING: ASPIRIN DOSE AND BRILINTA EFFECTIVENESS
<item>Maintenance doses of aspirin above 100 mg reduce the effectiveness of BRILINTA and should be avoided.
WARNING: ASPIRIN DOSE AND BRILINTA EFFECTIVENESS
BRILINTA is contraindicated in patients with hypersensitivity (e.g. angioedema) to ticagrelor or any component of the product see Adverse Reactions (6.2).
<item>Like other antiplatelet agents, BRILINTA increases the risk of bleeding.
<item>In PLATO, use of BRILINTA with maintenance doses of aspirin above 100 mg decreased the effectiveness of BRILINTA.
<item>Dyspnea: Dyspnea was reported more frequently with BRILINTA than with clopidogrel.
BRILINTA increased the overall risk of bleeding (Major + Minor) to a somewhat greater extent than did clopidogrel.

In general, risk factors for bleeding include older age, a history of bleeding disorders, performance of percutaneous invasive procedures, and concomitant use of medications that increase the risk of bleeding (e.g., anticoagulant and fibrinolytic therapy, higher doses of aspirin, and chronic nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs NSAIDS ).

entity.text: medications that increase the risk of bleeding

ellipsisSentence.text: Drugs that inhibit platelet function including BRILINTA increase the risk of bleeding.

middleSentence.text: BRILINTA increased the overall risk of bleeding (Major + Minor) to a somewhat greater extent than did clopidogrel.
The increase was seen for non-CABG-related bleeding, but not for CABG-related bleeding.
Fatal and life-threatening bleeding rates were not increased see Adverse Reactions (6.1).

sentence.text: Stopping BRILINTA increases the risk of subsequent cardiovascular events see Warnings and Precautions (5.5) and Adverse Reactions (6.1).
In PLATO, use of BRILINTA with maintenance doses of aspirin above 100 mg decreased the effectiveness of BRILINTA.
Therefore, after the initial loading dose of aspirin (usually 325 mg), use BRILINTA with a maintenance dose of aspirin of 75-100 mg see Dosage and Administration (2) and Clinical Studies (14).

mmtx.phraseText: use BRILINTA with a maintenance dose of aspirin of 75-100 mg
the initial loading dose of aspirin
use BRILINTA with a maintenance dose of aspirin of 75-100 mg

sentence.text: In PLATO, dyspnea was reported in 14% of patients treated with BRILINTA and in 8% of patients taking clopidogrel.

Dyspnea was usually mild to moderate in intensity and often resolved during continued treatment, but occasionally required discontinuation (0.9% of patients taking BRILINTA versus 0.1% of patients taking clopidogrel).
In the case of intolerable dyspnea requiring discontinuation of BRILINTA, consider prescribing another antiplatelet agent.

Avoid use with strong CYP3A inhibitors, such as atazanavir, clarithromycin, indinavir, itraconazole, ketoconazole, nefazodone, nelfinavir, ritonavir, saquinavir, telithromycin and voriconazole see Drug Interactions (7.1) and Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).
Avoid use with potent CYP3A inducers, such as rifampin, dexamethasone, phenytoin, carbamazepine, and phenobarbital see Drug Interactions (7.2) and Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

middleSentence.text: Avoid use with strong CYP3A inhibitors, such as atazanavir, clarithromycin, indinavir, itraconazole, ketoconazole, nefazodone, nelfinavir, ritonavir, saquinavir, telithromycin and voriconazole see Drug Interactions (7.1) and Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

sentence.text: <item>Avoid use with strong CYP3A inhibitors or CYP3A inducers.

ellipsisSentence.text: Ticagrelor is predominantly metabolized by CYP3A4 and to a lesser extent by CYP3A5.

sentence.text: <item>Patients receiving more than 40 mg per day of simvastatin or lovastatin may be at increased risk of statin-related adverse effects.

ellipsisSentence.text: Ticagrelor is predominantly metabolized by CYP3A4 and to a lesser extent by CYP3A5.

middleSentence.text: <item>Avoid use with strong CYP3A inhibitors or CYP3A inducers.

sentence.text: <item>Monitor digoxin levels with initiation of or any change in BRILINTA.

Avoid use of strong inhibitors of CYP3A (e.g., ketoconazole, itraconazole, voriconazole, clarithromycin, nefazodone, ritonavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, indinavir, atazanavir and telithromycin) see Warnings and Precautions (5.6) and Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

ellipsisSentence.text: <item>Monitor digoxin levels with initiation of or any change in BRILINTA.

sentence.text: Avoid use with potent inducers of CYP3A (e.g., rifampin, dexamethasone, phenytoin, carbamazepine and phenobarbital) see Warnings and Precautions (5.7) and Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).
Use of BRILINTA with aspirin maintenance doses above 100 mg reduced the effectiveness of BRILINTA see Warnings and Precautions (5.2) and Clinical Studies (14).
Ticagrelor is an inhibitor of CYP3A4/5 and the P-glycoprotein transporter.
7.4 Simvastatin, lovastatin
BRILINTA will result in higher serum concentrations of simvastatin and lovastatin because these drugs are metabolized by CYP3A4.

mmtx.phraseText: result in higher serum concentrations of simvastatin
result in higher serum concentrations of simvastatin

sentence.text: Avoid simvastatin and lovastatin doses greater than 40 mg see Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

ellipsisSentence.text: BRILINTA will result in higher serum concentrations of simvastatin and lovastatin because these drugs are metabolized by CYP3A4.

sentence.text: Digoxin: Because of inhibition of the P-glycoprotein transporter, monitor digoxin levels with initiation of or any change in BRILINTA therapy see Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

mmtx.phraseText: monitor digoxin levels with initiation of

sentence.text: BRILINTA can be administered with unfractionated or low-molecular-weight heparin, GPIIb/IIIa inhibitors, proton pump inhibitors, beta-blockers, angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors, and angiotensin receptor blockers.
